title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Company Description**

**About CyberArk**:  
CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit our CyberArk blogs or follow us on X, LinkedIn or Facebook.

 **Job Description**

CyberArk is seeking a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with a passion for sales strategy and business insight to join our Business Analytics team. In this role, you will act as a strategic partner to Sales and Sales Operations leaders around the globe—translating data into compelling narratives that drive better, faster decisions. You’ll play a key role in shaping how performance is measured, understood, and improved across our global go-to-market (GTM) organization. While you’ll contribute to dashboard development and scalable reporting in Tableau, this role goes far beyond building reports—you’ll be expected to uncover trends, connect dots across complex datasets, and communicate insights in a way that resonates with non-technical audiences. The ideal candidate is a business-minded analyst with strong sales acumen, excellent communication skills, and an instinct for asking the right questions to get to the heart of the problem.

**Responsibilities:**

* Serve as an embedded analytics partner to global Sales and Sales Operations stakeholders, proactively identifying opportunities to improve pipeline, productivity, and conversion
* Craft clear, executive-ready narratives based on deep-dive analyses of sales performance, pipeline coverage, segmentation, and revenue trends
* Translate complex data and technical concepts into actionable recommendations that are easy for non-technical stakeholders to understand and act upon
* Design and evolve self-service dashboards and tools in Tableau that reduce friction and enable faster time-to-decision
* Maintain a high bar for data accuracy and consistency across reports and ad hoc deliverables
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, RevOps, Marketing, Finance, and IT to align on business definitions and ensure reliable analytics infrastructure
* Help drive a data-driven culture by enabling stakeholders to interpret KPIs and use insights effectively

#LI-JA1

#LI-Hybrid

 **Qualifications**  

* 4–6 years of experience in Sales Analytics, Sales Operations, Business Intelligence, or a related field
* Proven ability to extract and communicate insights from complex data—especially in a Sales or GTM environment
* Strong business judgment, with experience working directly with senior stakeholders and cross-functional teams
* Working knowledge of SQL and experience with Tableau or a similar BI platform (depth of tool expertise less important than the ability to learn quickly)
* Understanding of B2B sales metrics, pipeline stages, and CRM data (Salesforce experience a plus)
* Excellent storytelling skills—both written and verbal—with the ability to tailor messages to executive and frontline audiences
* Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and isn’t afraid to ask questions or challenge assumptions
* Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or business-related field
* Smart, bold but humble attitude to work collaboratively with CyberArk colleagues

  
**Additional Information**

CyberArk is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa at this time.

The salary range for this position is $87,000 – $121,000/year, plus commissions or discretionary bonus, which will be based on the employee’s performance. Base pay may also vary considerably depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The compensation package includes a wide range of medical, dental, vision, financial, and other benefits.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**WE ARE HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS OF AMERICA.** Our mission is to elevate healthcare standards, improve patient outcomes, and create value for communities across the United States. Healthcare Systems of America (HSA) is more than a healthcare provider-we're a community built on excellence, innovation, and compassion. If you're looking for a career that makes a difference, empowers you to grow, and gives you the opportunity to impact lives, HSA is where you belong.

Healthcare Systems of America operates 8 community hospitals across 3 states. We service a multitude of patients and their families across our vast network, while remaining committed to the professional development of our staff, the functional improvement of our patients, and the cultivation of strong partnerships within our communities.

**WHAT WE OFFER**

* Career GrowthDevelopment - We are an essential, stable and growing company with many opportunities for training and advancement within the medical field that all employees and team members can benefit from.
* SupportiveInclusive Culture - We foster an environment where every team member is valued, heard, and empowered to succeed.
* Meaningful Work - Every day, you'll contribute to patient care, cutting-edge medical solutions, and life-changing treatment and technologies.

**POSITION SUMMARY**

The Analyst will play a key role in collecting, analyzing, and reporting healthcare data to support decision-making and strategic planning across our network. This role requires strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. The Analyst will work cross-functionally with clinical, operational, and administrative teams to improve healthcare delivery and patient outcomes.

**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Collect, validate, and analyze data from clinical, financial, and operational systems across HSA's hospital network.
* Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations that communicate key performance indicators (KPIs), trends, and opportunities for improvement.
* Collaborate with department leaders and front-line staff to identify data-driven solutions to organizational challenges.
* Perform ad hoc and recurring analysis to support quality improvement initiatives, resource allocation, and patient care strategies.
* Translate complex data into clear and actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Assist with regulatory and accreditation reporting requirements, including CMS, Joint Commission, and state-level mandates.
* Work with IT and data governance teams to ensure data integrity, security, and compliance.
* Contribute to predictive modeling and population health initiatives aimed at improving outcomes and reducing costs.
* Stay informed of trends in healthcare analytics, informatics, and policy to drive innovation within the organization.

**EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS**

* Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Accounting, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field required.
* Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, healthcare analytics, or a related field.
* Experience with Axiom is highly preferred.
* Experience in a hospital, healthcare system, or health insurance environment is highly desirable.
* Master's degree preferred but not required.

**SKILLS/REQUIREMENTS**

* Proficiency in data analysis tools such as dashboards, databases, etc.
* Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Qlik would be a plus.
* Strong understanding of healthcare data sets including EHR, claims, quality metrics, and patient outcomes.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize work in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively across departments.
* Knowledge of HIPAA and data privacy standards.

title: Business Analyst (ITIL Configuration)
description:
**Job Overview:**

* The configuration manager oversees the configuration management process, as a key function within the IT Service Management team, ensuring all configuration items (CI) are accurately documented and maintained.
* This individual is responsible for establishing and maintaining the configuration management plan and coordinating with various IT teams to enforce CM practices.
* Their work involves defining configuration identifications, managing configuration changes, and conducting reviews & audits to ensure compliance with HHS agency policies and standards.
* The configuration manager must ensure that CM tools and resources are used effectively.
* They act as a bridge between operations, infrastructure, applications, and ITSM teams to guarantee that everyone is aligned with the CM strategy.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies.
* Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective.
* Familiar with industry standard business process mapping, and reengineering. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc.
* Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.

**EXPERIENCE-**

**Required Qualifications & Skills:**

* ***5 Years:*** Advanced knowledge of ITIL configuration management principles and best practices; prior experience in developing and maintaining configuration management process & polices.
* ***5 Years:*** Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills and a strong attention to detail.
* ***5 Years:*** Experience supporting and maintaining CMDB platforms such as BMC Helix, ServiceNow, Atlassian, etc.
* ***4 Years:*** Performs regular configuration audits to verify their completeness, accuracy, and compliance with the CM plan and system objectives.
* ***4 Years:*** Responsible for verifying and auditing the configuration status and assists with configuration verification, to ensure that the CIs are consistent with their specifications and requirements.
* ***4 Years:*** 3-5 years of demonstrated work experience as a Configuration Manager or a similar role overseeing IT Service Management processes & standards.
* ***4 Years:*** ITIL 4 Foundation certification.

**Contract Details:**

* The primary work location(s) will be at **4601 W. Guadalupe St. Austin, TX 78751**.
* The working position is Hybrid. ***Position will be 3 days remote with 2 days (Tuesdays and Thursdays) required to be onsite at the location listed above. Program will only accept LOCAL ONLY candidates for this position.***
* Services shall be provided during normal business hours unless otherwise coordinated through the **Texas Health and Human Services Commission**. Normal business hours are Monday through Friday from **8:00 AM to 5:00 PM**, excluding State holidays when the agency is closed.
* Services are expected to start **07/21/2025** and are expected to complete by **08/31/2025**. Total estimated hours per Candidate shall not exceed **280** hours. This service may be amended, renewed, and/or extended providing both parties agree to do so in writing.
* ***S# 529501430***

* Monday to Friday

* maintaining CMDB platforms: BMC Helix & ServiceNow: 5 years (Required)

title: Data/Business Analyst
description:
Nature’s Way Farms is one of the largest tropical shrub and ornamental nurseries in Florida. We have more than 40 years of experience growing plants on hundreds of acres. We service garden centers in large mass market retailers across the country. We are looking for an addition to our production planning team.

**Responsibilities**  
The Analyst will be responsible for data manipulation, validation, and analysis to support plant production. A significant portion of the role involves extensive data handling in Excel, along with entry-level interpretation and analysis. The Analyst will ensure the integrity and accuracy of data through regular audits and reviews. Attention to detail is essential for identifying discrepancies and making necessary adjustments, ensuring all data is precise and reliable.

**Qualifications**

· The role requires in-office attendance Monday through Friday.

· A Bachelor's degree in business, mathematics, finance, data science, or a related field, or relevant experience in data analysis.

· Advanced proficiency in Excel is required.

· Some prior office experience, including internships, is preferred.

· Strong attention to detail and the ability to handle repetitive administrative tasks. A proactive mindset with a desire to learn, experiment, and take calculated risks is crucial for success and career growth.

· Ability to work outdoors to observe and understand products is required.

· Bilingual in Spanish and English is a significant advantage.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage applications from candidates regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status. We believe that diversity enriches our work culture and enhances our ability to serve our customers and partners.

Nature's Way Farms is proud to maintain a drug-free workplace. Our commitment to maintaining a drug-free environment extends not only to our employees' safety but also to upholding our professional standards and promoting a positive work atmosphere.

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
**Everyone belongs at Malarkey!**

**Malarkey takes pride in selecting our most important asset, our employees. Become a part of our mission to manufacture and deliver innovative, performance-driven building products with service and integrity that is unparalleled.**

The **Pricing Analyst** will help determine competitive pricing strategies to gain market share and achieve revenue goals. They will analyze data from multiple sources, develop complex pricing models, and collaborate with Sales Operations Management, Sales Management, and the sales team to develop strategies.

  

* Assesses data from various sources to gain insights into pricing strategies and market trends.
* Participates in current pricing tasks as well as analysis to move the company into a better overall pricing strategy, processes, and workflow.
* Analyzes competitor pricing and market trends to increase market share and profitability.
* Tracks customer engagement to develop effective pricing strategies for products and offerings.
* Applies statistical modeling methods to determine the potential impact of pricing strategies on profitability.

**Knowledge, Education, and Experience**

A bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, economics, or related fields is required. A master's degree in business administration is preferred. At least five years of experience as a pricing analyst in a similar industry. Proficiency in business intelligence (BI) software, Microsoft Power BI. In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis. Extensive experience in analyzing pricing strategies and forecasting revenue and market share. Experience in collaborating on pricing strategies with sales and marketing departments. Ability to keep abreast of industry trends and develop dynamic pricing tools. Advanced ability to present pricing analysis reports to relevant stakeholders-excellent analytical and communication skills.

* Expert-level Excel skills are required.
* Analytical: Strong analytical skills are necessary to compare sales trends and determine market data.
* Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential, as pricing analysts work with team members at all levels, including store associates, office staff, and executive team members.
* Detail-oriented: The ability to pay close attention to detail while remaining accurate is crucial in the analysis of large collections of data.
* Problem-solving: Pricing analysts use problem-solving skills to identify declining sales trends and devise strategies to improve them.

**When you join the Malarkey family, you have access to enhanced health care designed to keep you and your family healthy for today and for the future. Malarkey also offers financial wellness planning and contributions to your retirement plan. Our programs allow our employees to thrive and achieve success both at work and in their personal lives. Malarkey offers Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Accident Death and Dismemberment, and a retirement plan.**

**Malarkey Roofing Products is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.**

**Today's Talent, Tomorrow's Success**

title: Sr. Business Analyst (AI)
description:
The Senior Business Analyst will join a team to lead the requirements gathering and business analysis work for an application development team building AI solutions for a federal government agency. They will be the primary point of contact to the customer, facilitating ideation, requirements, and working sessions to plan, design, and develop AI solutions to drive efficiencies into existing government systems and processes. The Senior BA will bring strong analytical, communication, and technical skills to bridge the gap between business stakeholders and the technical team. They will independently gather and document business requirements / user stories, create workflows and Visio diagrams, and facilitate the successful delivery of AI-driven solutions. Responsibilties include:

* Facilitate requirements workshops, stakeholder meetings, and regular status updates to ensure clarity and progress
* Create and update user stories throughout the Agile development process
* Identify opportunities for leveraging AI to improve business processes and operations.
* Develop and maintain process workflows, diagrams, and visual representations of requirements using tools such as Microsoft Visio.
* Collaborate with the technical team to design and implement AI-driven solutions, ensuring alignment with business objectives

Projected compensation range for this position is $120K - $140K. The final salary offered will generally fall within this range and is determined by various factors, including but not limited to the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as internal pay equity, location, contract-specific affordability and other organizational requirements.

Required Skills

* 8+ years of business analysis for IT systems
* Strong working knowledge of AI tools and technology
* Proven experience in a senior BA role, independently working with business users and driving IT development work
* Experience working within Agile development teams
* Experience gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements / user stories from stakeholders across various departments
* Must be a US Citizen

Desirable Skills

* Experience working for federal government customers
* Active Fedeal Government Public Trust clearance
* AI related certifications
* Certified Scrum Master;

title: Accela Senior Business Analyst
description:
Link Technologies (LinkTechConsulting.com), a Las Vegas-based IT consulting firm, is currently seeking an Accela Senior Business Analyst to join our team.

***JOB SUMMARY***  
This position serves as a liaison between business users, functional subject matter experts, systems analysts, and technical developers. Responsibilities include analyzing business processes by assessing current and future state process flows, documenting process diagrams, eliciting and documenting requirements, performing system fit/gap analysis, contributing to design specifications, developing and overseeing technology-related request for proposals, and participating in systems testing. As a key member of technology services, this role contributes to delivering high customer value through innovative solutions and plays a crucial part in exceeding customer expectations.

***QUALIFICATIONS***

* Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information systems, business administration, mathematics or a related field. o Additional appropriate type and level of experience may be substituted for the minimum education requirement on a one (1) year for one (1) year basis.

***Minimum of five (5) years of recent, professional-level experience in business analysis, including at least two (2) years in a lead role on projects of varying sizes. This experience should include:***

* Leading process analysis and improvement initiatives that span multiple teams or departments.
* Identifying and delivering enterprise-wide system enhancement recommendations.
* Conducting technical evaluations in complex, highly integrated software system environments.
* Developing process and system diagrams to document current and future state operations.
* Producing end-user training documentation or converting technical content into training materials.
* Creating process handoff and system integration diagrams across interconnected systems.
* Collaborating effectively with peers, customers, and vendors to achieve shared outcomes.
* Assisting both technical and non-technical stakeholders in understanding the impact of process handoffs on requirements and system integrations.
* Clearly documenting workflows for use by internal teams and organizational leadership.
* Defining requirements to integrate new tools into existing technical infrastructure.

***ADDITIONAL SKILLS REQUIRED***

* Must be able to obtain CJIS Certification within 90 days from start date.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Highly self-motivated with strong organizational abilities.
* Focused on delivering exceptional customer experiences.
* Proficient in facilitating customer interactions and engagements.
* Skilled in problem analysis and root cause identification.
* Effective in preparing and delivering presentations on a variety of topics.
* Experienced in building consensus and managing conflict.
* Capable of conducting successful negotiations.

***PREFERRED EXPERIENCE***

* Experience across a broad spectrum of technology solutions
* ITIL/ITSM
* Agile/Scrum
* Business Process Management (BPM)
* Lean Six Sigma / Lean process development
* Change Management
* Business case development and delivery
* Accela or similar workflow platforms
* Experience with AI tools is a plus
* Microsoft Office including Visio, Azure DevOps

***RESPONSIBILITIES***

* Act as principal liaison for business stakeholders and as a key point-of-contact to technology services, internal/external agencies, and vendors on their behalf.
* Facilitate team understanding and elicit requirements for systems, integrations, and future state functionality.
* Partner with business stakeholders to identify problems/opportunities, assist in developing these into project/initiatives, and work within technology services to move these into the project pipeline.
* Understand business processes and system capabilities for complex, integrated systems.
* Work with vendors to understand system intricacies and process needs to advocate for the best possible solution.
* Utilize Azure Dev Ops (ADO) for all project tracking purposes.
* Create functional process fit/gap analysis documentation which identifies and recommends resolution of any process, system, and integration related gaps.
* Make suggestions for any as-is or to-be processes which are lacking and/or present a risk and help mitigate them, before they become an issue.
* Follow TS best practices: documentation, project, and change management processes.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders, technology services teams, internal/external agencies, vendors, et. al to support the organization’s mission, vision, and goals.

***Pay range: $60-$65/hr***

Link Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other factors protected by law.

title: Sr. Analyst, Commerce & Growth Product Analytics
description:
**Company Description**

NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.

Comcast NBCUniversal has announced its intent to create a new publicly traded company ('SpinCo') comprised of most of NBCUniversal's cable television networks, including USA Network, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel along with complementary digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass, and SportsEngine. The well-capitalized company will have significant scale as a pure-play set of assets anchored by leading news, sports and entertainment content. The spin-off is expected to be completed during 2025.

 **Job Description**

The Media Group at NBCU supports a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands including Peacock, NBC, Bravo, NBC Sports, and NBCU International. With unequalled scale, our teams make the most out of every opportunity to collaborate and learn from one another. We’re always looking for ways to innovate faster, accelerate our growth and consistently offer the very best in consumer experience. But most of all, we’re backed by a culture of respect. We embrace authenticity and inspire people to thrive.

**Responsibilities:**

* Partner with the Senior Manager of Product Analytics to optimize acquisition product experiences, providing a data-driven, objective perspective that aligns cross-functional teams on performance against key goals.
* Execute against an acquisition analytics and experimentation roadmap for the Commerce Product & Growth teams, deriving insights that drive impact for the business
* Work within large datasets to interpret trends and turn those into sound recommendations
* Maintain, update, and distribute actionable dashboards or reports to ensure data democratization and informed decision making
* Partner with Data Engineering teams to identify and enhance data sources
* Prepare and inform material for senior level executive presentations
* Leverage data visualization tools like Tableau to curate reporting for cross-functional teams

  
**Qualifications**  

* 4+ years of experience working with analytics engineering and product analytics stack (e.g. Databricks, BigQuery, Tableau, Looker, Airflow, dbt, Github, etc.)
* 4+ years of applied experience in acquisition, subscriptions, direct to consumer or media entertainment. Familiarity with data challenges specific to subscription and user behavior analytics.
* Proficiency in dimensional modeling and designing datasets for business analytics use cases, preferably within Databricks.
* Advanced SQL skills for analytics and data analysis (Python or R.)
* Experience performing analysis with large time series datasets.
* Experience in defining data collection and measurement requirements.

**Desired Characteristics**

* Curious and passionate about democratizing data access and scalability; you operate with a bias for informed action.
* Possess a growth mindset and see failure as a necessary step towards advancing learning of yourself and those around you.
* Collaborative and skilled in working across teams to align insights and technical solutions with business objectives.

**Additional Requirements:**

**Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.

This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.

*Salary range: $85,000 - $115,000*

 **Additional Information**

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Claims Data Analyst
description:
Enjoy problem-solving, need a venue to display your creativity, and emerging technologies pique your interest; if so, Barrow Wise Consulting, LLC is for you. As a multi-disciplined leader, you understand the gifts that set you apart from everyone else. Demonstrate innovative solutions to our clients. Join Barrow Wise Consulting, LLC today.

**Responsibilities:**

The Claims Data Analyst will support Barrow Wise's DHS project and perform the following duties:

* Perform data mapping from the raw database to Medicare A and B format
* Develop custom code to transform the data to X12 EDI format for 837I and 837P
* Collaborate with the client to further refine data input
* Find trends in datasets and develop workflows and algorithms to make raw data applicable to the enterprise
* Design and implement standardized data management procedures around data staging, data ingestion, data preparation, data provisioning, and data destruction (scripts, programs, automation, assisted by automation, etc.)
* Ensure quality of technical solutions as data moves across environments
* Provide insight into the changing data environment, data processing, data storage, and utilization requirements, and offer suggestions for solutions
* Map the details within these artifacts to business processes, non-functional characteristics, QA criteria, and technical enablement
* Ensure managed analytic assets support strategic goals by creating and verifying data acquisition requirements and strategy
* Develop, construct, test, and maintain architectures
* Create data and solution architecture with business requirements and use programming language and tools
* Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality
* Deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning, and statistical methods
* Use data to discover tasks that can be automated
* Create data monitoring capabilities for each business process and work with data consumers on updates
* Help maintain the integrity and security of the company data
* Work remotely part-time or full-time

An ideal candidate has the following:

* U.S. Citizenship
* Bachelor's degree
* 7 years of experience in healthcare claims systems development, implementation, and operations; CMS experience preferred
* 5 years of experience in database management, automation, ETL, Python programming, and data analytics
* Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

Join the team at Barrow Wise Consulting, LLC for a fulfilling and engaging experience! Our team is dedicated to providing innovative solutions to our clients in an ethical and diverse work environment. We offer competitive compensation packages, excellent benefits, and opportunities for growth and advancement. Barrow Wise is an equal-opportunity, drug-free employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veteran/LBGT are welcome to apply.

Our employees stand behind Barrow Wise's core values of integrity, quality, innovation, and diversity. We are confident that Barrow Wise's core values, business model, and team focus create positive career paths for our employees. Barrow Wise will continue to lead the industry in delivering new solutions to clients and persevere until the client is overjoyed.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Graham Technologies is seeking a highly skilled Senior Business Analyst with deep expertise in Business Process Reengineering (BPR), systems requirements, and enterprise software development to support a mission-critical program within the Intelligence Community (IC). The ideal candidate will play a key role in bridging business needs and technical solutions, leading requirements documentation efforts, and ensuring software development aligns with enterprise goals. This role demands a hands-on, analytical professional capable of leading collaborative efforts across diverse teams, guiding technical solutions from concept through delivery, and ensuring alignment with stakeholder expectations.

**Location:** Reston, VA

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Apply systems engineering principles to define system and software requirements for enterprise applications.
* Perform complex analysis and research involving financial and acquisition systems, identifying inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and refine business and technical requirements, translating them into structured documentation.
* Develop process flows, workflow diagrams, and system interaction maps using tools like MS Visio to clearly communicate requirements.
* Lead Business Process Mapping and Analysis sessions to document current and future states of operations.
* Create detailed engineering design documentation that guides software development teams.
* Assist in the creation and execution of system test plans to validate functionality and performance of delivered solutions.
* Serve as a liaison between end users and technical teams to ensure all requirements are well-understood, documented, and implemented correctly.
* Conduct and facilitate requirements gathering sessions, user story workshops, and working group meetings.
* Monitor and manage risks, changes in scope, and project dependencies, delivering strategic recommendations to stakeholders.
* Provide regular reports and briefings to project stakeholders on requirements status, project health, and key deliverables.
* Lead pilot demonstrations and support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) efforts to validate end-user functionality.

**Required Skills:**

* Must possess active DoD Top Secret/SCI with CI Poly or ability to obtain a CI Poly
* Bachelor's degree in business, Computer Science, Systems Engineering, or a related field.
* 8+ years of relevant experience in systems/business analysis or related roles.
* Proven experience working on federal or IC programs, with preference given to candidates familiar with government acquisition and financial systems.
* Demonstrated experience in requirements gathering, documentation, and validation processes.
* Strong understanding of IT systems design, development, and engineering documentation.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including experience presenting to executive stakeholders.
* Experience working in agileor hybrid environments with both government and contractor teams.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and customer service

**Preferred Skills:**

* Prior experience in a team leads or senior-level analytical role.
* Knowledge of business process management platforms.
* Familiarity with government acquisition and finance workflows.
* PMP (Project Management Professional)
* Proficiency in tools like JIRA, Confluence, or equivalent for requirement tracking

Compensation:

At Graham Technologies, we believe in treating everyone with fairness and respect. Our compensation package is designed to ensure fair pay for work, reflecting our commitment to integrity.

Many IT companies offer similar services, but what truly sets us apart is our people! We care deeply about our employees and consistently show our appreciation-not just for the final outcomes, but also for the effort and dedication shown every step of the way. Additionally, our generous benefits package supports our team members in living fulfilling and prosperous lives.

Here are just a few highlights of what we offer:

* Four Weeks of Accrued PTO in the First Year
* Eleven Paid Federal Holidays
* Comprehensive Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* 401(k) Plan with Annual Employer Contributions
* Flexible Schedules
* Reimbursements for Continued Education and Training

Why Graham Technologies?

Our core values define who we are:

* Value our Customers
* Care about our Employees
* Passionate about Innovation
* Believe in a Strong Work Ethic
* Rely on Teamwork
* Integrity Matters

Founded in 2007, GTech is a consulting services firm passionate about delivering tailored solutions that meet our clients' needs and maximize the value of their investments. We achieve this by providing top-notch professionals across the IT industry. Our team embodies integrity, commitment, and reliability, which are at the heart of everything we do.

We are also dedicated to fostering a culture of support for our employees-the lifeblood of our business. At Graham Technologies, we've built a family-oriented environment where team members are encouraged to maintain a healthy work-life balance, pursue their passions, and grow professionally through flexible schedules, continued education, and a strong sense of community.

title: Data Analyst
description:
***GENERAL POSITION DESCRIPTION***

The Data Analyst organizes, cleans, maintains and analyzes CLD’s organizational and programmatic data. This role provides the data and analysis to answer key research questions to drive the collection of program data and inform program improvements through the Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI) process. The Data Analyst completes systematic and routine audits of the Apricot database to check for redundancies or errors to ensure high quality, accurate data for reports.

The Data Analyst also manages the data dashboards developed via Tableau data visualization software.

It is essential that the person in this role have excellent analytical skills and knowledge of Black youth opportunities and challenges.

***ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES***

* Establishes and maintains the infrastructure of the shared database system (Apricot).
* Ensures the cleanliness and completeness of data, identifying redundancies and errors as well as oversees data audits at direction of the Manager of Program Evaluation.
* Imports data into database and cleans the corrupt and inaccurate data after import. I.e.: Tableau, Apricot)
* Provides and oversees Staff Trainings for a variety of areas, including but not limited to proper data entry practices, data audit and clean up, Apricot use and guidance, Tableau product and dashboard use.
* Assures identified staff are provided Tableau credentials and training.
* Works collaboratively with the Manager of Program Evaluation to analyze how data is coming in and how it will need to be organized so that when it is needed, it can easily be used i.e.: shared database, IXL, and National Student Clearing House.
* Optimizes Apricot for performance and data quality to include monitoring database performance to determine when action is needed.
* Tracks, troubleshoots and resolves user issues and concerns related to the Apricot database.
* Coordinates with the Apricot customer service team when needed.
* Exports and connects data from all data tools (Apricot, Survey Monkey, NSC, NWEA, etc.) to complete analysis and prepare data visualization for summary reports.
* Creates charts and graphs for data summary reports, such as grant proposals and reports, board reports and other requests.
* Develops and maintains business intelligence dashboards to track impact metrics, understand data trends and create reports and visualizations for CLD Leadership using Tableau.
* Works with the Manager of Program Evaluation to define and design data analysis projects
* Pulls from external sources, when requested by the Manager of Program Evaluation. Examples may include pulling comparison data from sources like the Census, STATS Indiana, or the Indiana Commission for Higher Education.
* Collaborates with the Manager of Program Evaluation on efforts to collect and analyze National Student Clearinghouse data annually, including running the CLD report from Apricot, cleaning and formatting the file in the required template, and analyzing the return of data from National Student Clearinghouse in Tableau. This review will be completed in collaboration with the Manager of Program Evaluation, Director of College Prep Institute, Assistant Director of College Prep Institute, Manager of Programs, and Manager of Community Programs. These key leaders inform and drive the Data Analyst's direction in answering program progress towards organizational benchmarks.
* Complies with mandatory attendance at the following annual CLD events: Minority Achiever’s Awards and Scholarship Gala, College Prep Conference and Indiana Black Expo.
* Follows professional personal presentation standards and adheres to the Dress Code Policy.
* May perform specialized activities in direct support of the accomplishment of the program objectives and the CLD mission.

***WORK EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS***

* Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy.
* Intermediate knowledge of Structured Query Language, commonly called SQL.
* Proficiency and experience with Tableau data visualization software or Microsoft Power BI.
* 2 years' experience in database management and data analysis.
* 1+years's experience in data visualization.
* Familiarity with Social Solutions Apricot software, a highly configurable database platform.
* Familiarity with National Student Clearing House.
* Familiarity with Monday.com project management web application.
* Functional skills with Windows 10, Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and Power Point.

***ATTRIBUTES***

· Communicator. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Self-starter. Takes the initiative to not only identify a problem but work to solve it.

· Critical thinker. Ability to analyze information objectively, evaluate evidence, question assumptions, and make well-informed decisions by applying logical reasoning and sound judgment to solve problems and reach conclusions.

· Team player. Works well independently, but recognizes value of working with teams.

· Flexible. Must be willing to learn quickly and respond to changing environment.

· Efficient. Able to multi-task, prioritize and manage multiple projects in a fast paced, customer-oriented environment while being detailed and highly organized.

· Passion. Must be excited about CLD’s mission, youth and the communities we serve.

· Impeccable character.

***EDUCATION and/or CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS***

Bachelor’s Degree- Data Management/Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology or a related field.

***PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/DEMANDS***

* Generally sedentary work, remaining in a stationary position for long periods of time, extensive computer usage, hand-eye coordination. Events do require physical exertion, including lifting of boxes and tubs, moving chairs and tables, loading and unloading supplies.
* Must have reliable transportation.
* Must be willing to work some evenings and weekends.

***WORK ENVIRONMENT***

This position operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers, scanners, laminators and photocopiers.

**\\*EOE/M/F/DISABILITY/VETERAN**

title: Business Analyst 4 YSI
description:
Yakshna Solutions, Inc. (YSI) is a woman-owned, small business enterprise headquartered in Herndon, Virginia. We are CMMI Level 3 assessed and ISO 9001, 20000:1, and 27001 certified. YSI delivers professional IT solutions and services to both commercial businesses and government agencies. Our mission is to provide innovative, high-quality, and cost-effective technology services to our clients.

We offer a competitive benefits package including:

* 401(k) retirement plan
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* Life insurance
* Short-term and long-term disability coverage
* Paid time off (PTO)
* Training and professional development support

Position Summary:

YSI is seeking an experienced and analytical **Business Analyst 4** to support the Virginia Information Technologies Agency (VITA) at their Richmond, VA office. The selected candidate will provide advanced financial and market analysis to support IT infrastructure sourcing and enterprise-level procurement activities. This role requires a high level of independence, collaboration, and initiative.

**Key Responsibilities:**

· Conduct in-depth market research related to IT services and pricing models

· Analyze data related to current service usage, consumption, and financial performance

· Assist in developing financial requirements and modeling for new solicitations

· Develop Power BI dashboards to support sourcing and procurement analysis

· Create effective reports and PowerPoint presentations with charts, graphs, and other visuals

· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop financial evaluation scenarios

· Create segmentation models of entities using VITA contracts and similar data

· Produce documentation for Market and Analytics Program processes

· Serve as backup for Market and Analytics Insights Manager during meetings

· Work independently in ambiguous or undefined project environments

· Translate complex financial data into clear and actionable insights

**Required Qualifications:**

· Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Information Systems, or related field (or equivalent experience)

· 7+ years of experience as a Business Analyst

· 6+ years of experience in financial analysis including evaluation of financial submissions and strength of businesses

· 6+ years of experience with Power BI for creating data-driven dashboards

· 6+ years of experience with SQL for data extraction and analysis

· 6+ years of experience developing clear and professional presentations using PowerPoint

· Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

**Preferred Qualifications:**

· 5+ years of experience in IT market research

· 5+ years of experience in procurement processes or sourcing support

**Note to Candidates:**  
If you have **experience in IT market research or procurement**, please ensure that it is **clearly stated on your resume**, as it is a preferred qualification for this role.

title: Teamcenter PLM Business Analyst
description:
**Position: Teamcenter PLM Business Analyst**

**Location: Remote, PST hours**

**Duration: 12+ Months (with possible extension)**

**Job description:**

The PLM Business Analyst Consultant will support critical PLM program, a global initiative to streamline and enhance Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) capabilities across the enterprise. This role focuses on analyzing business requirements, coordinating with cross-functional stakeholders, supporting organizational change management (OCM), and driving PLM process improvements.

**Scope of Work and Key Responsibilities:**

**1. Business Analysis & Solution Design**

* Triage, author, clean up, and manage Teamcenter PLM-related user stories and functional requirements.
* Upload, track, and maintain requirements and user stories in JIRA to ensure accurate documentation and visibility.
* Map user stories to User Functional Requirements Specifications (UFRS) and ensure alignment with business process documentation.
* Collaborate with Product Owners and SMEs to validate business needs and document acceptance criteria.

**2. Workshop Facilitation & Stakeholder Engagement**

* Plan, facilitate, and document outcomes of cross-functional workshops related to PLM processes and system enhancements.
* Act as a liaison between business users and technical teams to gather feedback, resolve ambiguities, and drive alignment.

**3. Test Planning & Validation Support**

* Assist in authoring test scripts and test cases based on user stories and acceptance criteria.
* Support user acceptance testing (UAT) and validation activities to ensure system functionality meets business expectations.

**4. Change Management & Communication**

* Collaborate with the OCM team to develop communications, stakeholder readiness plans, and training content.
* Support deployment communications and user onboarding for new PLM capabilities.

**5. Sustaining & Operational Support**

* Develop and support communications strategy for managing aging Change Requests (CRs) and Change Notices (CNs).
* Assist in creating reusable job aids and process documentation for ongoing end-user education.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in PLM business analysis or consulting roles.
* Strong understanding of Siemens Teamcenter PLM system
* Experience supporting large-scale PLM transformations or digital initiatives.
* Demonstrated ability to manage requirements, lead workshops, and deliver training materials.
* Familiarity with regulated environments (FDA, ISO standards) is a plus.
* Proficient in tools such as JIRA, Confluence, Excel, and Microsoft Office Suite.

**Preferred Competencies:**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and manage priorities in a matrixed organization.
* Strong stakeholder engagement, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.

description:
**About PSCI LIA**

Pinnacle Software Consulting Inc (DBA PSCI-LIA) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Women-Owned, 8A Small Business, mission-driven small business with a strong legacy of delivering high-impact professional services to government agencies in program management, logistics, IT, and administrative support. As of April 16, 2025, Linkitall LLC was acquired by PSCI- LIA, ensuring continuity of service while expanding capabilities - preserving our core functions and commitment to excellence. To learn more about the merger of PSCI-LIA and Linkitall LLC, please visit: PSCI-LIA | Where Strategy Meets Execution.

**Description**

Pinnacle Software Consulting Inc, (DBA PSCI-LIA) is seeking a **Senior Data Center Technical Support Analyst** in Baton Rouge, LA to support wide variety of existing hardware platforms, operating systems, database management systems, networks, third party software, and custom applications.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Network Design and Topology services, including LAN/WAN and Wi-Fi
* Architect LAN/WAN topologies leveraging Cisco Nexus, Catalyst, and SD-WAN solutions.
* Design multi-tier server infrastructure using Hyper-V, VMware vSphere, and Citrix to meet performance and HA requirements.
* Implement storage solutions (NetApp, Dell EMC) and SAN zoning to satisfy capacity and IOPS targets.
* Servers - Design of Tier 1, Tier 2, Tier 3 business needs and workstation management
* Backup and Recovery Strategy for servers, network devices, and other business critical applications.
* Develop and maintain backup and recovery strategies leveraging Veeam, Commvault, and Azure Backup.
* Coordinate disaster-recovery drills, update runbooks, and ensure RPO/RTO compliance.
* Perform regular health checks, patching, and firmware upgrades across compute, storage, and network layers.
* Application rationalization - confirm applications will function in the new server/network environment
* Strategize network and server migration plans.

**Required QualificationsExperience:**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Engineering, or related discipline. VMware VCP or Microsoft MCSE certifications preferred.
* 10+ years in data center operations, engineering, or technical support roles.
* Strong expertise with virtualization platforms (VMware vSphere, Hyper-V, or Citrix XenCenter Virtual Suites) and Microsoft Windows Server Operating Systems (to include Domain Services).
* Experience with enterprise backup, disaster recovery, and high-availability design.
* Proficient in automation scripting (PowerShell, Python) and configuration management tools.
* Knowledge of ITIL processes and change management best practices.

**Preferred Experience:**

* User Profile analysis and migration
* Desktop and Mobile Device imaging and user transition
* Data analysis, Application Rationalization, and migration
* Third party software to be migrated and handled on a case-by-case basis
* Cisco Nexus Infrastructure
* CrowdStrike Endpoint Protection
* Tanium Endpoint Management
* Disaster Recovery backup solutions

title: InfoSec Vulnerability Metrics & Data Analyst (Remote)
description:
**Company Description**

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com

 **Job Description**

As an **InfoSec Vulnerability Metrics & Data Analyst**, you will provide data-driven insights contributing to our organization's security strategy and vulnerability management practices. You will establish and maintain regional and global reports to support the Cloud and Application Attack Surface Management scope, embrace and integrate a threat-informed approach, and perform analytical reviews to enhance Experian's Cloud and Application Attack Surface Management.

You will join our Cloud and Application Attack Surface Management team and report to the Director of Attack Surface Management.

**You'll have the opportunity to:**

* Guide the development of vulnerability management metrics, gathering feedback and sharing metrics with senior leaders
* Evaluate and define functional requirements for vulnerabilities, flaws, and misconfiguration metrics
* Develop, maintain, and run advanced reporting, dashboard, and scorecard results
* Communicate metrics to system owners and partners on outstanding vulnerabilities, issues, and concerns
* Develop and automate vulnerability metrics with specific procedures for data collection, analysis, and charting, partnering with necessary teams
* Determine requirements for technical solutions and tools to implement Vulnerability Metrics
* Develop vulnerability KPIs and metrics to demonstrate coverage and remediation effectiveness
* Develop program efficacy metrics to support platform stability and improvements
* Review business and internal requests for new or vulnerability management reporting, design the solution, and develop metrics
* Work with stakeholders to identify risk-based vulnerability management metrics that align with the security program and security risk management.
* Develop procedures to structure the metrics and reporting framework as part of a long-term strategy
* Produce scoping documents outlining the requirements for business requests
* Provide recommendations based on data analysis and findings related to vulnerability management processes
* Aggregate vulnerability data across technologies such as endpoints, servers, network equipment, and cloud and interpret and present risk.

  
**Qualifications**

**Your background:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or 5+ years of equivalent work experience in Cyber Security/Information Security and Vulnerability Management reporting
* Experience with tools such as SQL, Tableau, PowerBI, and Excel
* Experience in ServiceNow query and report development
* Experienced with collaboration tools such as ServiceNow and Confluence
* Understanding of the end-to-end security metrics process, including metrics collection, tracking, and reporting
* Understanding of Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS), including calculations and implications of base, temporal, and environmental scoring factors
* Experience collecting, analyzing, and interpreting qualitative and quantitative data from several sources to detail results and analyze findings to provide threat intelligence
* Familiarity with architecture, engineering, and operations of one or more vulnerability management tools, such as Wiz, Qualys, Rapid7, and ServiceNow
* Knowledge of major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
* A broad understanding of cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, controls, and remediation strategies
* #LI-Remote

**Benefits/Perks:**

* Great compensation package and bonus plan
* Core benefits including medical, dental, vision, and matching 401K
* Flexible work environment, ability to work remotely, hybrid, or in-office
* Flexible time off including volunteer time off, vacation, sick, and 12-paid holidays

  
**Additional Information**

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; Great Place To Work™ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is an important part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.
