title: SENIOR DATA BASE ANALYST
description:
Requisition No: 846507

Agency: Highway Safety and Motor Vehicle

Working Title: SENIOR DATA BASE ANALYST - 76000155

Pay Plan: Career Service

Position Number: 76000155

Salary: $72,000.00 - $78,000.00 annually

Posting Closing Date: 06/23/2025

**Total Compensation Estimator** **Tool**

**Division Of** **Information Systems Administration**

**Borough Of Enterprise Database Services**

  

**Career Service (CS) Opportunity**

  

**\\*Open Competitive Advertisement\\***

  

**\\*\\*\\*This opportunity is telework eligible in the continental United States\\*\\*\\***

  

**To be considered for this position, applicant responses to qualifying questions must be clearly stated within the employment history. Software systems, actual work experience, and years of employment must be clearly defined, or the application may not be considered for the position.**

  

**Contact Person: Coretha Gaymon, 850-617-2225**

  

**The Organization**

The Florida Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles (FLHSMV) provides highway safety and security through excellence in service, education, and enforcement. With a workforce of approximately 4,500 employees throughout the state, the Department is leading the way to A Safer Florida through the efficient and professional execution of its core mission: the issuance of driver licenses, vehicle tags and titles, and operation of the Florida Highway Patrol.

  

**Our Benefits include**

* Paid Parental Leave
* Annual and Sick Leave Package
* Nine Paid Holidays
* State Health and Life Insurance
* Educational Benefits
* Contributory Retirement Plan

  

To learn more about FLHSMV and why it’s a great place to work, visit our website at:**flhsmv.gov/careers**.

  

**Duties and Responsibilities**

As a Senior Database Analyst (SQL)you will be responsible for the design, implementation, patching, and ongoing maintenance of all database instances on multiple environments, including the release process for system and schema changes. Perform database query analysis, performance, and optimization and coordination of stored procedures and maintaining an appropriate database access layer. In addition, the Senior Database Analyst is responsible for database performance, scalability, replication, and database reporting and reports to the SQL Services Database Administrator. This position requires exceptional technical, analytical and collaboration skills. The successful candidate must have the ability to communicate effectively, precisely, and accurately across all levels of the organization.

  

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

* Skill in SQL Server database administration.
* Skill in working in Windows operating systems.
* Skill as a SQL developer.
* Skill in creating stored procedures.
* Skill in supporting SQL Server data replication and validation.
* Skill with SQL Server software installation, patching, and upgrading.
* Ability to work independently and to resolve complex issues.
* Ability to effectively diagnose, isolate, and resolve complex problems pertaining to server and data infrastructure.
* Ability to write T- SQL, Stored Procedures, Functions, and Database Triggers.
* Ability to Tune SQL and T-SQL queries for performance.
* Operational support skills, including experience with system installations, migrations and upgrades.
* Knowledge of Windows scripting.
* Skill in logical database design and data models.
* Knowledge of the software development lifecycle process.
* Practical experience in monitoring and tuning a database to provide a high availability service.
* Ability to maintain currency on tools, methodologies, and technologies related to data administration.
* Knowledge of data privacy and protection initiatives.
* Strong interpersonal skills to resolve problems in a professional manner.
* An ability to effectively communicate technical data processing information verbally and in writing.
* Knowledge of SQL Server backup/recovery technologies and processes.
* Knowledge of SQL Server Replication practices and processes.
* Knowledge of SQL Server Clusters and Failover methodologies.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**

Preference will be given to applicants who have experience:

* System/Application/Database development, design and/or administration.
* Developing in T-SQL or PL/SQL languages.
* Assisting application/web development teams and business area customers in the design, deployment, and development of solutions.

  

**Job Related Requirements**

* Normal work hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m., although being on-call and working after hours and on weekends may occasionally be required.
* **The position you are applying is subject to a Level 2 background check, along with Criminal Justice Information System (CJIS) clearance, to include a fingerprint-based check of the criminal records of the FBI, as a condition of employment pursuant to Chapter 110.1127, 435 and 943, Florida Statutes. Please note that, since this position requires CJIS clearance, the Department will have access to all an applicant’s criminal and juvenile delinquency records, even those that have been sealed or expunged.**

  

**General Information**

* The elements of the selection process may include a skill assessment and/or oral interview.
* Applicants being considered for employment will be required to submit to a fingerprint-based background investigation, which will include a check of the criminal history records of the FBI. Fingerprints and associated information/biometrics will be retained in the FBI’s Next Generation Identification (NGI) system and fingerprints may continue to be compared against fingerprints submitted to or retained by NGI.
* FLHSMV employees are paid once a month on the last workday of each month. All state employees are required to participate in the direct deposit program pursuant to s. 110.113 Florida Statutes.

  

The State of Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action Employer, and does not tolerate discrimination or violence in the workplace.

Candidates requiring a reasonable accommodation, as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act, must notify the agency hiring authority and/or People First Service Center (1-866-663-4735). Notification to the hiring authority must be made in advance to allow sufficient time to provide the accommodation.

The State of Florida supports a Drug-Free workplace. All employees are subject to reasonable suspicion drug testing in accordance with Section 112.0455, F.S., Drug-Free Workplace Act.

**VETERANS’ PREFERENCE.** Pursuant to Chapter 295, Florida Statutes, candidates eligible for Veterans’ Preference will receive preference in employment for Career Service vacancies and are encouraged to apply. Certain service members may be eligible to receive waivers for postsecondary educational requirements. Candidates claiming Veterans’ Preference must attach supporting documentation with each submission that includes character of service (for example, DD Form 214 Member Copy #4) along with any other documentation as required by Rule 55A-7, Florida Administrative Code. Veterans’ Preference documentation requirements are available by clicking here. All documentation is due by the close of the vacancy announcement.

title: Business Data Analyst, Hybrid - Healthcare Operations Experience
description:
**Business Data Analyst, Hybrid - Healthcare Operations Experience** **(****42910****)** **-**Erlanger Baroness Hospital Chattanooga, TN

Business Data Analyst, Hybrid - Healthcare Operations Experience

Regular - Exempt - Full-time - **Standard Hours** 37.5

**Description**

Job Summary:
  
The Business Data Analyst is a quantitative specialist who understands the business needs of a physician group and how to use data to achieve those needs. They are responsible for organizing and managing large and varied data sets, analyzing healthcare data to optimize business operations, and communicating their findings using data visualization and detailed reports.
  
  
The Business Data Analyst will assist in coordinating all aspects of provider compensation and establish effective monitoring processes for the organization. Leads and/or works on special projects as needed for the business office.
  
  
Education:  
Required: Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, healthcare administration, or related field.  
  
Preferred: Master's degree in mathematics, statistics, healthcare administration, or related field.  
  
Experience:  
Required:  

* Analytical mindset with good problem-solving skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Experience with data visualization tools.
* Ability to function independently and in a team environment.
* Ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities and a diverse workload, while achieving results in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project), internet research and database functionality.
* The ability to work with minimum supervision, set priorities, and follow through to accomplish results.

  
  
Preferred:  

* Previous physician contracting background
* Previous healthcare data analytics background
* Active membership in the American Association of Provider Compensation Professionals

  
Position Requirement(s): License/Certification/Registration  
Required: N/A  
  
Preferred: N/A  
  
Department Position Summary:
  
The Business Data Analyst, EMG is a quantitative specialist who understands the business needs of a physician group and how to use data to achieve those needs. They are responsible for organizing and managing large and varied data sets, analyzing healthcare data to optimize business operations, and communicate trends and findings using data visualization and detailed reports. The analyst will assist in coordinating financial and operational analysis including provider compensation and reimbursement, operational key performance indicators, audits and quality analysis, and establish effective monitoring processes for the organization. Serves as liaison to staff, physician, practice leadership, and organizational executive leadership related to financial and operational performance of the medical group. Serves as training liaison to practice leaders, staff, and physicians that focus on performance outcomes, and serves as key stakeholder with Erlanger eChart in reporting optimization and results to enhance operational and financial performance.  

* Compiles and organizes financial and operational data
* Gathers and organizes information for problem solving
* Understands data storage and data sharing methods and effectively utilizes resources
* Analyzes data to assist in delivering optimal healthcare management and decision making
* Uses healthcare data to achieve administrative needs and goals
* Investigates data to find patterns and trends
* Converts data into usable information that is easy to understand
* Develops reports and presentations
* Communicates analytic insights to management
* Calculates and manages physician pay incentives
* Audits eChart and provider compensation systems to resolve RVU (pay) incentive questions
* Works closely with Coding, Internal Audit, and Payroll/HR to address provider issues and problem solve
* Calculates quality incentives, tracks call, shift pay, medical directorship pays and all other forms of provider compensation
* Serves as stakeholder for provider pay incentive-based software system (Simpliphy) including enters provider contracts and validates accuracy
* Processes provider base salary and FTE changes
* Performs comprehensive analyses related to physician compensation and physician productivity, including monthly true-up calculations and salary draw monitoring
* Audits provider dashboards
* Develops and implement tools and processes to support physicians and operational leaders in their understanding of physician compensation and production
* Completes data analysis of monthly Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for EMG and communicates executive level and service line level data timely
* Coordinates with EMG Operational Performance (Training) Team on KPI areas of opportunities and assist in training clinic staff in system workflows that optimize performance
* Monitors clinic budgets and communicates variances with applicable clinic leaders
* Assists in regular communication with physicians regarding their compensation plans
* Creates models, custom reporting packages, and ad hoc reports to meet the information needs of internal stakeholders and senior leadership of EMG
* Ensures adherence to current policies and procedures while emphasizing their significance in workflow
* Remains flexible and adaptive in business functions, making changes to procedures as necessary
* Notes necessary changes to be made in current policies and procedures, discusses such with Sr. Director Business Operations and/or VP Operations, EMG.
* Contributes to positive business results by maintaining a workplace characterized by high performance, mutual support, respect, and teamwork
* Demonstrates excellent communication skills across all areas of the organization
* Other duties as assigned to support provider contracting and business operations
* Serves as a liaison on behalf of the Business Office leadership to executives and physicians as needed.

title: Business Analyst - Growth Strategy & Analytics
description:
**Posting Date**

06/18/20252000 16th Street, Denver, Colorado, 80202, United States of America

Revenue Operations (ROPS) supports the DaVita Village through arranging dialysis placements, verifying coverage, generating and submitting claims and coordinating with payors. This position is responsible for completing complex analyses, solving ambiguous problems, making decisions to improve processes and building reports in order to drive strategic improvements across one or more of the business teams within Revenue Operations.

**Primary responsibilities of this role:**

Analysis & Technical Skills:

* Responsible for performing analyses by aggregating data across multiple data sources
* Understands where and how to get data across multiple databases without guidance
* Evaluates the business impact of various efforts by building analytical models & determining variable assumptions
* Develops reporting with advanced skills in tools such as Excel, SQL and Tableau
* Troubleshoots issues & QC’s work to produce error-free output

Problem Solving:

* Solves ambiguous problems by breaking down key drivers and developing an approach to solving. This may include recommending new or updated system functionality to solve business needs, changes to team processes or work prioritization, etc.
* Understands how metrics & processes within a business are interrelated and corresponding implications for their work
* Synthesizes key takeaways from an analysis & recommends actions; presents summary by visualizing analysis results

Project & Stakeholder Management:

* Effectively leads working sessions
* Directs & executes on next steps within work streams for which they are responsible; proactively communicates around roadblocks and creates/maintains project plan
* Builds collaborative relationships with business partners and stakeholders

**What Skills Do You Bring to the Role?**

* Bachelor's degree in related field of study (STEM, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business)
* 2-4 years’ experience OR applicable work experience; Master’s degree preferred
* Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills required; experience using other analytical tools such as SQL, Tableau, VBA, Python, Access, etc. preferred
* Strong quantitative & problem solving skills including analytical modeling and insight generation
* Ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple, easily digestible manner to a range of audiences including senior leaders
* Commitment to DaVita's values of Service Excellence, Integrity, Team, Continuous Improvement, Accountability, Fulfillment and Fun
* Experience in healthcare and/or revenue cycle preferred

* Comprehensive benefits: Medical, dental, vision, 401(k) match, paid time off, PTO cash out
* Support for you and your family: Family resources, EAP counseling sessions, access Headspace®, backup child and elder care, maternity/paternity leave and more
* Professional development programs: DaVita offers a variety of programs to help strong performers grow within their career and also offers on-demand virtual leadership and development courses through DaVita’s online training platform StarLearning.

What We’ll Provide:

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Get to know Okta**  
  
Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology, anywhere, on any device or app. Our flexible and neutral products, Okta Platform and Auth0 Platform, provide secure access, authentication, and automation, placing identity at the core of business security and growth.  
  
At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  
  
Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.

**Position Overview:**

The Business Analyst (BA) is a key role on the Okta Professional Services team responsible for leading the effort associated with gathering, analyzing and documenting business and functional requirements for the deployment of Okta Identity and Access Management (IAM) for customers. This role acts as a liaison between key customer stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring that the implementation meets business needs, and adheres to best practices in identity and access management. The BA is also responsible for ensuring requirements traceability through the duration of the project.

Please note, you must be located in Mexico City and able to communicate proficiently with English speaking clients to be considered for this role.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Business Requirements Development**

  + **Stakeholder Engagement & Requirements Elicitation**
    - Identify and engage with key stakeholders including (but not limited to): IT, security teams, digital & product owners, business units and end-users.
    - Conduct interviews and workshops to gather requirements and understand current IAM processes and pain points.
    - Elicit detailed business and functional requirements through various techniques such as requirements gathering workshops, brainstorming, focus groups, and document analysis.
  + **Analysis & Requirements Documentation**
    - Analyze current state processes and systems to identify gaps and areas for improvement.
    - Evaluate the feasibility of various solutions and provide recommendations based on cost, time and resource considerations.
    - Document detailed business requirements, functional requirements, and non-functional requirements. Ensure requirements are clearly articulated, complete, and aligned with business needs.
    - Create business process flow diagrams to capture and communicate requirements clearly.
    - Create necessary functional solution design diagrams to visually represent the people and process flows as depicted by the documented business, functional, and non-functional requirements.
  + **Traceability**
    - Ensure all requirements are documented in adherence to Okta's Business Requirements Document (BRD) template, and are in a traceable and maintainable format, linking each requirement to specific business needs and project outputs.
    - Ensure requirements are traceable throughout the project lifecycle, from initial requirements gathering activities to implementation and testing.
    - Use traceability matrices to track status and fulfillment of requirements, ensuring that all business and functional requirements are met.
    - Conduct reviews and audits to confirm that requirements are being addressed appropriately during each project phase.

* **Project Lifecycle Support**

  + **Project Coordination**
    - Support the project manager (PM) in developing project plans, timelines, and resource allocations for business analyst related activities
    - Monitor project progress for business analyst related activities, and assist the PM with reporting on respective milestones, risks and issues.
  + **Technical Translation & Implementation Support**
    - Work closely with the customer and Okta Professional Services Technical team members (Technical Architect, Technical Consultant) to assist with the translation of business requirements into technical specifications.Ensure proposed solutions align with business needs and comply with industry standards.
    - Provide oversight with technical consultants during build phase activities to clarify any functional or business needs questions as it relates to technical configuration of captured requirements.
    - Support reconciliation of any business requirements variances that may not have been originally captured if discovered during the build phase.
  + **Quality Assurance Transition**
    - Develop acceptance criteria for each documented business requirement to validate the implementation meets the documented requirements, ensuring traceability to documented and agreed upon requirements.
    - Work with Quality Assurance (QA) team members to ensure they can consume acceptance criteria to develop test cases.
    - Work with QA leads to enable them to advise the customer on coordination of user acceptance testing (UAT) and to gather feedback that ensures the solution meets user needs.

* **Post-Implementation Support**

  + **After Go-Live Activities**
    - For a predefined period of time as specified by the project scope, the BA will work along with a scaled-down project team (PM, TC, QA) to support customer questions and triage issues should they arise.
    - Works with technical & quality assurance team members to update documentation if and when changes occur to the system after go-live of the Okta implementation.

**Required Skills and Qualifications**

**Technical Skills:**

* **IAM Knowledge:** Strong understanding of Identity and access management principles and best practices.

* **Okta Expertise:** Proficient in Okta's WIC/CIC platforms and offerings, including its features, functionalities and integration capabilities.

* **Technical Acumen:** Ability to understand technical specifications and communicate them to non-technical stakeholders.

**Analytical Skills:**

* **Problem-Solving:** Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify issues and propose effective solutions.

* **Attention to Detail:** Meticulous attention to detail in documenting requirements and validating solutions.

**Communication Skills:**

* **Interpersonal Skills:** Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels.

* **Documentation Skills:** Strong writing skills to create clear and concise documentation and reports.

**Project Management Skills:**

* **Organization Skills:** Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and projects.

* **Time Management:** Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

**Educational Background (Preferred):**

* **Degree:** Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field.

* **Certifications:** Relevant certifications such as Okta Certified Professional/Administrator/Consultant or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) are preferred.

**Performance Metrics:**

* **Requirement Accuracy:** Accuracy and completeness of requirements documentation.

* **Stakeholder Satisfaction:** Level of satisfaction among stakeholders with the requirements gathering process and final implementation.

* **Project Timeliness:** Ability to meet project deadlines and milestones.

* **Solution Quality:** Quality and effectiveness of the implemented Okta solution in meeting business needs.

* **User Adoption:** Rate of user adoption and satisfaction with the implemented Okta solution.

* **Traceability Effectiveness:** Success in maintaining requirements traceability throughout the project lifecycle.

#LI-Remote

**What you can look forward to as a Full-Time Okta employee!**

* Amazing Benefits
* Making Social Impact
* Developing Talent and Fostering Connection + Community at Okta

Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.  
  
Some roles may require travel to one of our office locations for in-person onboarding.

Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and convictions records, consistent with applicable laws.
  
  
If reasonable accommodation is needed to complete any part of the job application, interview process, or onboarding please use this Form to request an accommodation.

Okta is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy at https://www.okta.com/privacy-policy/.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Business Analyst**

NXT is looking for a Business Analyst with expertise in systems development to join our team. The Business Analyst will work with a talented and diverse team to support complex IT project initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving strategic initiatives, optimizing operational efficiency, and delivering innovative solutions for clients.

**Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate closely with agency stakeholders to understand business objectives, challenges, and requirements
* Conduct comprehensive analysis to gather, document, and validate business requirements, ensuring alignment with project objectives and industry standards
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather business requirements for system enhancements and drive the implementation of solutions
* Utilize quantitative and qualitative analysis techniques to interpret complex data sets, identify patterns, and derive actionable insights
* Conduct comprehensive analysis to understand the current system's architecture, processes, and limitations
* Identify areas for improvement and efficiency gains, and work with stakeholders to gather requirements for the project
* Develop comprehensive business requirements, use cases, and process flows for new systems
* Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and IT teams to ensure successful system transformation results
* Conduct risk assessments and impact analyses to evaluate potential risks and opportunities associated with proposed solutions or business changes
* Contribute to project planning, monitoring, and execution activities, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality solutions within budget and scope
* Develop and execute change management strategies and plans to facilitate a smooth transition to new systems
* Create detailed documentation of business processes, system requirements, and change management plans
* Analyze data and generate meaningful insights to inform decision-making processes
* Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to improve performance and efficiency
* Maintain documentation to ensure alignment with evolving business needs and regulatory requirements
* Collaborate with IT teams, business teams, and other stakeholders to bridge the gap between business needs and system capabilities

**Must Haves – Required Skills:**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or related field
* 5+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst
* Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques (e.g., SQL, Excel, Tableau)
* Ability to translate business requirements into actionable process improvements
* Experience working in an Agile Environment
* Experience with process improvement methodologies such as Lean Six Sigma or ITIL Continual Service Improvement
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Consulting experience

**Nice to Haves – Desired Skills:**

* Relevant industry certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMP, Lean Six Sigma)

**Location:**

Hybrid: Client site and Remote

**Benefits:** Why you want to work with us!

* We are a young and vibrant organization with a strong foundation and looking for the next set of leaders to grow the business.
* Fully company-paid healthcare for you and your family
* Monthly expense of $100 paid towards health and wellness expenses of your choice – gym, yoga classes, massages, etc.
* Monthly reimbursement for phone bill up to $100
* Unlimited paid annual leave
* Work from anywhere as long as quality work is getting done
* Flexible hours – take breaks, cater to your personal and family appointments during the day as needed, core hours 9-4
* We want our employees to be eternal learners – we will pay for reasonable and relevant trainings and certifications
* We want you to participate in the company’s growth – healthy bonus and performance-based commissions to be discussed during the hiring process depending on the applicability to the role

NXT is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

title: Strategic Analyst
description:
**Strategic Analyst – Nuclear Emergency Planning**  
**Location:** Pearl Harbor, HI (Remote work considered for exceptionally qualified candidates)  
**Salary Range:** $90,000 – $125,000 per year  
**Employment Type:** Full-time

**Zimmerman Associates, Inc. (ZAI)** is currently seeking a highly skilled and motivated **Strategic Analyst** to support **Nuclear Emergency Planning (EP)** efforts for **Pacific Fleet (PACFLT)** organizations. This position plays a critical role in advancing Naval Nuclear Propulsion Program (NNPP) readiness and preparedness, with a particular focus on support for AUKUS-related planning, policies, and strategic initiatives.

### **Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop, implement, and support NNPP Emergency Planning project initiatives within PACFLT EP organizations.
* Support the development and integration of AUKUS program-related policies, processes, and organizational strategies.
* Conduct in-depth research on U.S. emergency preparedness programs to inform PACFLT EP planning and execution.
* Assist the PACFLT EP Director in creating, implementing, and monitoring organizational improvement plans.
* Provide development and advisory support on corporate NNPP initiatives.
* Participate in occasional domestic and international travel in support of PACFLT EP duties.

### **Qualifications & Requirements:**

* Demonstrated expertise in NNPP emergency planning at Naval Shipyards and/or Fleet sites.
* Hands-on experience supporting the AUKUS Program.
* Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a **SECRET Security Clearance** and access to **Naval Nuclear Propulsion Information (NNPI)**.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills; able to build and maintain effective working relationships.
* Capable of exercising sound judgment and maintaining professional discretion in sensitive situations.

**Work Location:**

* Primary: Pearl Harbor, HI
* **Remote work may be considered for exceptionally qualified candidates.**

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

**ZAI is an equal opportunity employer. In compliance with Federal and State Equal Opportunity Laws, qualified applicants are considered for all positions applied for without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, veterans’ status, or any other legally protected status.**

title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
description:
We’re looking for experienced and passionate Data Analysts to join one of our agile analytics teams. Our ideal candidate is adept at modeling complex data, uncovering patterns, and delivering data-driven insights to help grow our business effectively and efficiently.

In this role you’ll be a strategic partner, working closely with senior department leaders to define and execute data analytics strategies.

**In this role you’ll**
-----------------------

* Be part of the Analytics chapter, spending your day-to-day as the data expert in our Revenue team
* Build and maintain the data analytics infrastructure for accurate and timely reporting and sophisticated analysis
* Set measurable and strategic goals, and build new measurement and optimization capabilities
* Initiate analyses and deliver business insights that lead directly to Growth & Revenue improvement
* Partner with other data analysts, as well as team members from Partnerships, CRM & User acquisition to push through cross-functional data projects

**What you’ll need**
--------------------

* 5+ years of experience in a data analytics role, preferably within a fast-growing consumer company
* Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
* Proficiency in SQL, a must
* Proficiency in data visualization, a must
* Hands-on experience with modern data analytics stack (e.g. Snowflake, dbt, Looker), strongly preferred
* Knowledge of Python or R, a plus
* Experience with common MarTech tools (e.g. Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Appsflyer), a plus
* Knowledge with marketing measurement and optimization framework (e.g. attribution, media mix modeling, incrementality tests)
* Familiarity with digital/offline marketing platforms and strategic partnerships, preferred
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with others
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
* Ability to work in an office environment a minimum of 3 days a week
* Enthusiasm about learning and adapting to the exciting world of AI – a commitment to exploring this field is a fundamental part of our culture
* ***Unfortunately we cannot consider applicants from the following states: Colorado, California, Montana, Hawaii, New Mexico and Puerto Rico***

***\\*\\*Please note that we are unable to sponsor applicants for Work Visas***

Lemonade's US base salary range for this full-time position is $120,000- $145,000, plus equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Speak to your recruiter to hear more about the specific salary range for your preferred location.

title: Water Quality Analyst I
description:
Golden State Water Company is one of the largest investor-owned water utilities in the United States. We deliver quality, reliable water to more than 1 million people in over 80 communities throughout California. Golden State Water has been in business for more than 90 years because we put customers first.

**POSITION DEFINITION:**  
The incumbent in this position is a part of the Water Quality Team and maintains databases, manages records, and tracks compliance. The Analyst is also responsible for preparing reports from databases to support the daily activities and long term goals of the department.

**Accountability**  

* Performs tasks to implement, maintain and comply with all water quality and environmental regulations and programs within the district.
* Assists in the preparation of reports for compliance purposes that may include but not be limited to: State Water Resources Control Board - Division of Drinking Water (DDW) Annual Report, Consumer Confidence Report, Public Health Goal Report, NPDES report, etc.
* Researches technical documents and assists in conducting water quality studies to achieve business objectives and goals.
* Maintains water quality and environmental databases, including CC&B and SAMS.
* Maintains water quality monitoring schedules and tracks samples and laboratory reports. Tracks environmental compliance records.
* Conducts data analysis, summarizes data with tables and graphs, and prepares reports and/or presentations as directed by the Water Quality Engineer or Water Quality Manager.
* Coordinates document management of records, reports, and regulatory correspondence.
* Maintains Cross-Connection Control Program. This may include maintaining administration functions and/or functions as performed by a Cross Connection Control Specialist (conducting surveys and making decisions related to backflow protection requirements). May be required to obtain Cross Connection Control Specialist certification.
* Uses hydraulic modeling to develop flushing plans.
* Coordinates meetings, agendas, action items and project schedules.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Skills and Competencies**  
**Skill #1: Organization**  

* Maintains organized compliance records and tracking system.
* Initiates corrective action for procedural, product, or process deficiencies.
* Manages database and prepare procedures and protocol for database entry.

**Skill #2:** **Analytical and attentive to details**  

* Able to analyze data, make observations, and draw preliminary conclusions.
* Able to perform QA/QC on database and make necessary corrections.

**Skill #3: Communication**  

* Able to conduct data analysis, summarize data with tables and graphs, and prepare reports and/or presentations
* Able to utilize personal computer systems, hardware and software, in the performance of work assignments, such as word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, graphics, databases, statistical analysis, Internet research, and e-mail functions.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**  
**Education:**  

* High school degree or equivalent
* Bachelor’s degree in engineering, environmental sciences, chemistry, biology, or related discipline strongly preferred

**Required Experience**  

* Two years of progressively responsible experience in three or more of the following areas: water quality, environmental regulations, compliance tracking, database management, data analysis, cross connection control, hydraulic modeling, and reporting writing
* A Bachelor’s Degree can substitute for the required experience
* Familiarity with local, state, federal environmental regulations or safety practices preferred
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written

**Qualities / Core Competencies:**  

* Familiar with database management and able to perform data query
* Good organizational skills
* Attentive to details
* A team player
* Excellent critical and analytical thinking skills.
* Excellent problem solving abilities.

May include but not limited to standing, climbing, walking, lifting, bending, pulling and/or pushing, grasping, reaching, stooping and crouching, sitting, typing, walking, reading, writing, color determination, speaking and listening for extended periods of time.

**BENEFITS**

Our Company supports our employees with rich benefit programs and resources to help them thrive today and prepare for tomorrow. Benefit options include medical, dental, and vision plans with the Company currently paying 85% of the monthly premium for employees and their eligible dependents. We also offer paid vacation and sick time and twelve Company paid holidays per year. To help our employees plan for the future, we offer both a 401(k) retirement plan as well as a Defined Contribution Profit Sharing retirement plan. Additional benefits include life, AD&D, and LTD insurance as well as health savings account and flexible spending plans.

**COMPENSATION INFORMATION**

The compensation range provided is in compliance with state specific laws. Multiple factors are used to determine the actual starting rate of pay for all of our positions, including specific skills, years of experience, education, certification(s), and other job related factors.

The responsibilities of this position will involve access to information that may be considered confidential, private and sensitive. Therefore, the individual filling this position will be required to both allow and pass a background check.

NOTE: Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with special needs to perform the essential functions.

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Opportunity Overview: Data Analyst - 1+ year CONTRACT/CONTRACT TO HIRE -** **US CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED**

Westinghouse/WECTEC Staffing currently has an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst role for the Westinghouse Parts Business (WPB). In this position, the individual will be responsible for changing the way the business uses and visualizes data. This role is important to the long-term success of a growing business unit within Westinghouse.

Analyze – Dive into large datasets using different software tools

Enhance – Optimize business processes using automation tools

Solve problems – Find patterns, think critically, analyze data, and report findings to stakeholders

Transform – Work on a team, to enhance the business’ view of the power of data

Communicate – Get out your ideas and findings to the broader team

  

**What your day-to-day looks like:**

* Analyze business processes to improve effectiveness
* Understand business data to create dynamic reports and dashboards (incl. Power BI, Excel, etc.)
* Develop automation tools using Power Automate software
* Process data and fulfil ad hoc requests from different stakeholders
* Understand Westinghouse Parts Business product scope and customer base to provide valuable insights
* Provide quality testing support for new reporting tools
* Improve data quality dimensions on existing business processing and reporting tools including Pega, Power BI
* Other tasks and projects as required

  

**What we need to see from you:**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university required.
* Business, data analyst, or engineering backgrounds preferred
* 4+ years of professional experience in business related fields
* Advanced knowledge of business concepts and business acumen.
* Strong data administration skills including experience with Microsoft Office. (Enterprise Resource Planning, specifically Pega and SAP, Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Power Automate are beneficial)
* Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills required
* Ability to effectively manage multiple internal and external stakeholders with competing priorities.
* Knowledge of applicable technical products and services is a plus

  

**Our Safety Pledge to You:**

If you are as committed to your success as we are committed to your safety, then this is the position for you! For us, our guiding principle has always been and will continue to be the safety of our people. It’s that simple!

  

**Why WECTEC Staffing Services?**

Through the ever changing and rapidly evolving contract labor market we continue to employ experienced, highly motivated, and qualified employees with proven track records to meet our clients’ needs. We have expanded our scope of services outside of the nuclear industry to include international contracts in more than five countries. Our dedicated employees’ range in expertise from highly specialized technical niche positions to corporate function positions and we want YOU to be a part of our impressive talent network!

title: Student Accounts Analyst
description:
The Student Accounts Analyst serves as a liaison between the Office of Student Accounts, Information Technology, and other departments. This role involves researching, analyzing, configuring, testing, and maintaining systems that support student accounts. Key responsibilities include managing daily billing, tuition and housing adjustments, processing weekly refunds, and overseeing annual 1098-T filings. The position requires an understanding of data workflows, strong collaboration within a multidisciplinary team, and effective communication with end-users and stakeholders. Additional duties include general support tasks such as responding to calls and emails.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education, Experience and Training:

* Bachelor’s Degree with concentration in Business Administration, Computer Information Systems or related field or equivalent experience.
* Experience in a Higher Education environment is highly preferred.
* Experience working directly with business stakeholders at all levels in the organization.
* Experience working with both internal and contract/vendor resources to solve business problems and implement solutions.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.

Knowledge, Skills, Ability:

* Knowledge and ability to utilize the Internet, Microsoft Office software, E-Commerce and ERP software such as Ellucian-Datatel or Workday or a related higher education software package.
* Knowledge and ability to utilize internal systems such as Perceptive Content, TouchNet, Entrinsik Informer, SQL Reporting Services and Blackboard Transact/Blackboard Reporting System.

* Demonstrates strong collaboration and inter-team skills. Has ability to listen well to others and accepts input from team members. Follows through with commitments and fosters mutual trust with fellow innovators.
* Flexibility and ability to plan, prioritize, and execute multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong organizational and time management skills including the ability to multi-task, prioritize competing work responsibilities and meet deadlines.
* Improve upon existing approaches by seeking opportunities to creatively transform current practices into fresh alternative solutions.
* Communicate effectively in both verbal and written form, as well as have an overall ability to be clear and concise in all communication.
* Establishes and maintains effective professional relationships with internal and external customers.
* Strong knowledge of reporting tools and report generation.
* Knowledge of 1098-T reporting for year-end tax purposes.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

* Acts as a liaison between departmental end-users, technical analysts, consultants and other third-party organizations in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of information systems and software to ensure optimal operational performance.
* Works closely with Director to identify opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driven changes.
* Assists in the preparation of proposals to develop new systems and/or operational changes.
* Analyzes the feasibility of, and documents the requirements for, new information systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the system design fits the needs of the Office of Student Accounts.
* Tracks and fully documents change for functional and business specifications; writes detailed universally understood procedures for permanent records and for use in training.
* Provides technical assistance in training, mentoring, and coaching Student Accounts staff.
* As directed by the Director, participates in studies of new and existing programs and special projects to determine feasibility – consults with the Director regarding organizational, procedural, technical, and fiscal research and analysis.
* Explores procedures to improve efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and/or improve internal and external customer service.
* Develops information system documentation to support efficient Student Account operations and prepares reports, written findings, and recommendations.
* Participates in the analysis and design of any computer database systems relating to Student Accounts.
* Assists in analyzing and reporting on other student account functions as needed.
* Handles and maintains year-end 1098-T reporting for third party vendor and distribution to students. Analyzes 1098-T information for accuracy and collaborates with team members on any adjustments needed. Responsible for handling calls from parents/students regarding 1098-T questions.
* Responsible for performing the daily billing functions of the Office of Student Accounts. This will include billing the tuition adjustments and housing assignment changes. Analyzing any changes in charges due to the billing function and making corrections as necessary.
* Handles questions regarding meal plan assignments and changes using Blackboard Transact. Communicates the information directly to the student and the other functional departments involved. Also, to include making any manual adjustments for taxes and meal plan charges that may arise.
* Works with the Director to process weekly batch and individual refunds. This will entail the review of accounts to make sure that the refunds are processed within the guidelines of the university as well as under compliance with Federal and State regulations.
* Will work directly with the Director to update and maintain the annual building of the Rate Tables. This will require analyzing of the new tuition and fee structure to make sure that the appropriate student body is being charged appropriately. Through this will develop more automated and effective ways to add charges onto student accounts.
* Will work directly with the Director and the Office of Student Life to update and maintain the annual building of the Room Rate Tables. This will require the analyzing of the new housing tier costs as well as the room class assignments to make sure that all housing charges are being recorded to the appropriate GL account.
* Participates in the development of new reporting that will enhance the effectiveness of the Office of Student Accounts. This will require the Data Analyst to work in conjunction with other team members and departments to find the individual reporting needs and begin the report building process.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

None

ACCOUNTABILITY:

As delegated by university policy, the incumbent assists with improving business process through information systems to meet budgetary requirements of the university. The incumbent works closely with the Director of Student Accounts to ensure compliance with university policies. This position contributes extensively to the University having a successful Student Accounts function.

For more information about this position, please contact Megan Inch, Director of Student Accounts at

minch@highpoint.edu

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Title

Business Analyst

Position Overview

Our ideal candidate has experience solving business problems with analytics and a passion for using data to drive competitive advantage for our RISK Management team. The Systems Analyst will partner closely with business users in Environmental Health and Safety teams to support, design and develop analytical solutions that empower data-driven decisions. The position is responsible for performing analysis and design related to business change requests, project requirements, and creating solutions. The candidate must have a passion for improving processes and systems utilized in RISK management to support safety, medical services, workers compensation, insurance, and security teams.

Job Description:

* Create user friendly dashboards and reports that enable business users to make data driven decisions.
* Collaborate, consult and advise with front-line managers and directors to collect business requirements, define successful analytic outcomes, and design supporting data models.
* Partner closely with business leads to consult on Advanced Analytic capabilities and provide innovative approaches towards solutions
* Displays a genuine interest to develop business acumen and understanding of key business drivers that are used in the development of analytic solutions
* Solve complex data problems to deliver insights which are used to achieve business outcomes.
* Serve as a business application subject matter and liaison with business solutions partners and vendors.
* Act as system administrator responsible for handling functional system configuration tasks and system access
* Create and maintain user documentation, training materials, and facilitate training as needed
* Engage regularly with users and department leadership to influence system users and ensure the successful adoption of Risk Management applications.
* Provide end user support to both corporate and plant level EHS managers in Corority and Origami
* Identify trends to create solutions with business partners.
* Provide loss forecasting (injury rates) based on past data
* Provide input and feedback to leadership team on developing trends, opportunity areas and other related developments in loss data.
* Stay up to date on applicable laws, rules, regulations, procedures and technical operations.
* Develop an understanding of Shaw’s data infrastructure and data sources relevant to the supported business areas utilizing Workday.
* Perform complex data analysis and data manipulations of large data sets from various sources with advanced analytics tools.
* + Conduct or help in the future design and implementation of predictive and prescriptive data models.
* Build and maintain strong relationships and strategic alignment with leadership across manufacturing, customer service, logistics, or other supply chain functions.

Requirements

* Bachelor's Degree required (Preferred in, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Data Analytics, or Environmental Health and Safety) or High School Diploma/GED and 5+ years relevant business experience.
* 3 to 5 years of experience designing, developing and implementing descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics solutions.
* 3 to 5 years of data engineering experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis.
* Demonstrate strong project management skills to lead analytic teams.
* Demonstrate strong business acumen to engage with multiple business areas and
* Ability to present to business leaders.

Preferred

* Experience delivering solutions utilizing analytics tools/languages such as SQL, Qlik, Tableau, Business Objects, Splunk, R, Python, SparkR.
* Prior experience in Environmental Health and Safety
* Prior experience with Corority and Origami is a plus

Required Competencies

* Execute Action Plan
* Influence Others
* Build Customer Satisfaction
* Innovate
* Coach and Support
* Learn continuously

Work Shift

8 Hr non-rotating shift, Hrs fall to in punch day, Observed Calendar, shift starts AM

Shaw Industries is an equal opportunity employer as to all protected groups, including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Sr. Analyst, Financial, AO
description:
**About American Ordnance**

At American Ordnance, we know the stakes and We do what we say! ® We’re the team working behind the scenes to make sure our nation’s front lines have safe, high-quality ammunition. As a trusted premier manufacturer of ammunition to the U.S. Military, some of our capabilities range from production of direct and indirect fire, warheads, to special projects and beyond. With more than 70 years of experience and Day & Zimmermann behind us, it’s no surprise that our teams consistently exceed expectations. Come join in on our purpose – We put people to work, we protect American freedoms, and we help our customers power and improve the world! https://aollc.biz

Join our dynamic team at American Ordnance as a full-time **Sr. Analyst, Financial, AO located in Middletown, Iowa.**

The Senior Financial Analyst is a primary partner with our program managers for all financial aspects of programs. This role is pivotal in driving Estimate at Completion (EAC) development and business performance by delivering actionable insights and outcome-focused analysis to support programmatic decision-making. The position holder will possess expertise in program financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting, with a strong emphasis on leveraging data to provide clear, impactful recommendations. Experience in industrial manufacturing, preferably within munitions, and proficiency in SAP or another comprehensive ERP system is preferred. The position holder should be adept at managing EACs, complex financial models, understanding cost structures, developing basis of estimates with program managers, and presenting information to both financial and non-financial stakeholders to guide and influence outcomes.

As the **Sr. Ananalyst, Financial, AO**, here’s the work you’ll do:

* Lead and manage the development of Estimate at Completions (EACs) in collaboration with program managers. Development financial planning process for programs, including budgeting, forecasting, and long-term financial modeling through active participation, communication and collaboration with program managers and plant operations management, supply chain, and legal. Provide strategic financial guidance to support program business objectives.
* Collaborate closely with program managers to develop detailed, competitive pricing proposals in response to government and commercial solicitations. Analyze cost elements, preparing pricing models, and ensuring compliance with regulatory and customer requirements. Support price strategy development and contribute to proposal reviews and audits as needed
* Analyze and evaluate program costs, ensuring accurate allocation and application within the manufacturing process. Identify areas for cost optimization and efficiency improvements. Drive process, reporting, and analytics improvements. Learn and leverage ERP and business intelligence tools in place to enhance automation of reporting and analysis, specifically usage of SAP Finance, PowerBI and SAP MRP.
* Prepare and present financial reports and slide presentations, including variance analysis, trend analysis, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to senior management and stakeholders. Provide actionable insights based on financial data.

**This role is for you if you have these skills:**

* Strong Analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills. Proven knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting, and cost control principles including Generally Accepted Accounting Principles. Planning and Analysis along with a strong operational understanding of business decision making.
* Ability to clearly and consistently get information across in a timely and effective manner both verbally and in writing via multiple methods (i.e., presentations to groups both large and small). Demonstrates the ability to influence decisions and stakeholders
* Proficiency in SAP or another comprehensive ERP system for data extraction, financial reporting, and analysis. Knowledge MRP concepts and their application in manufacturing operations, with specific knowledge of SAP MRP a plus..
* Possesses and demonstrates familiarity with GAAP, CAS, FAR, DFAR, and applicable government regulations.

**Key Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting.
* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in financial planning and analysis within a manufacturing environment, preferably in munitions or industrial manufacturing
* Ability to analyze complex financial data and provide actionable insights. Strong attention to detail and accuracy in financial reporting. Experience in a munitions or industrial manufacturing environment desired. Experience in dealing with financial and regulatory audits and reporting requirements

**Thrive at American Ordnance!**  
We offer a competitive salary in the range of $86,160 - $129,240 (based on experience and location) and a benefits package that goes beyond the basics. From health insurance to family leave and pet insurance, we support your well-being inside and outside of work.

**SO WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? APPLY NOW!**

**We care about our employees and it shows.** Our staff receive a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical/Rx, dental and vision coverage; life, AD&D and disability insurance; flexible spending accounts; 100% paid maternity leave for up to 12 weeks, parental leave, family leave, other paid time off; voluntary benefits and discount programs to meet our employees’ individual needs including pet insurance for our furry family members!

**To ensure a safe work environment while meeting the physical demands of the job, you must be able to perform the following physical and mental tasks, with or without a reasonable accommodation:**

* Visual acuity (e.g., needed to prepare and analyze data, to transcribe documents, to view a computer, to read, to inspect objects, to operate machinery.
* Reaching (e.g. reaching the arms or legs in any direction)
* Walking
* Repetitive motion of any part of the body
* Manual Dexterity (e.g. picking, pinching, typing, or other working that uses fingers)
* Climbing (e.g. ascending/descending ladders, stairs, scaffolding, ramps, pole, etc. using feet and legs and hands/arms to climb)
* Hearing
* Talking
* Capacity to think, concentrate and focus for long periods of time.
* Ability to read complex documents in the English language.
* Capacity to reason and make sound decisions.
* Ability to write complex documents in the English language.
* Capacity to express thoughts orally.
* Expertise in:
* Ability to regularly perform all job functions at Company’s office or worksite.

**Diversity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity**

American Ordnance, a Day & Zimmermann Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V. Diversity, and Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity: American Ordnance is committed to maintaining an inclusive workforce, where employees are hired, retained, compensated and promoted based on their contributions to our Company. Our collective strength is rooted in over 110 years of diverse employees and businesses, commitment to success, and delivery on promises made. Federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity laws prohibit employment discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation and gender identity, age, national origin, citizenship status, veteran status and disability status. American Ordnance is committed to providing an equal opportunity work environment in full compliance with these laws. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation in the application process, please email reasonableaccommodation@dayzim.com.

title: Analyst, Data & Insights, GamesNew
description:
**The** **mission** **of The New York Times is to seek the truth and help people understand the world. That means independent journalism is at the heart of all we do as a company. It’s why we have a world-renowned newsroom that sends journalists to report on the ground from nearly 160 countries. It’s why we focus deeply on how our readers will experience our journalism, from print to audio to a world-class digital and app destination. And it’s why our business strategy centers on making journalism so good that it’s worth paying for.**

### **About the Role**

The Times is looking for a creative analyst who is passionate about data and eager for the opportunity to support the Games team. Within the Data and Insights Group (DIG), the New York Times has fostered a large community of experienced analysts who partner with Product, Engineering, Design, and PMO teams across the business. For this role, you'll work within our DIG Game Analytics team to support the Live Operations group.

You'll partner with producers, product managers, engineers, designers, marketers, and editors to support our vision of being the premier destination for digital puzzle games. You'll analyze data, produce insights, build data pipelines, construct dashboards, run experiments, and more while working on a product that is beloved by tens of millions of users every week. You will report to the Senior Manager of Analytics for LiveOps within Games. This is a hybrid position.

  

### **Responsibilities:**

* Analyze large datasets to help inform decision-making as it relates to
* Write SQL in dbt to develop data models, pipelines, and infrastructure that create evergreen solutions and support the wider analytics team.
* Set up and run A/B Tests - design the tests, provide scope and analysis, present findings, and advise on next steps
* Develop dashboards to expand access to data and analytics
* Perform analysis to create insights, advocating for them, and guiding them into action
* You will help maintain live dashboards that show the operational health and status of our games.
* You will learn the fundamentals of incident response and support post-event data gathering.
* You will help document live event configurations and their performance for future optimizations.
* Demonstrate support and understanding of our value of journalistic independence and a strong commitment to our mission to seek the truth and help people understand the world.

  

### **Basic Qualifications:**

* 1+ years of experience working with data teams to deliver reporting and analysis or an advanced quantitative degree
* Proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases
* Some experience with data visualization tools such as Mode, Tableau, or Looker

  

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* 1+ years of experience in digital/app product analytics
* 1+ years of experience designing data specs and testing for data integrity
* Some experience in Python or R
* Familiarity with A/B testing

#LI-Hybrid

  

REQ-018434

**The annual base pay range for this role is between:**

$88,000 - $95,000 USD

The New York Times Company is committed to being the world’s best source of independent, reliable and quality journalism. To do so, we embrace a diverse workforce that has a broad range of backgrounds and experiences across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics. The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC)’s Know Your Rights Poster is available.

The New York Times Company will provide reasonable accommodations as required by applicable federal, state, and/or local laws. Individuals seeking an accommodation for the application or interview process should email reasonable.accommodations@nytimes.com. Emails sent for unrelated issues, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.

The Company will further consider qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable "Fair Chance" laws.

  

Please beware of fraudulent job postings. Scammers may post fraudulent job opportunities, and they may even make fraudulent employment offers. This is done by bad actors to collect personal information and money from victims. All legitimate job opportunities from The New York Times will be accessible through The New York Times careers site. The New York Times will not ask job applicants for financial information or for payment, and will not refer you to a third party to do so. You should never send money to anyone who suggests they can provide employment with The New York Times.

If you see a fake or fraudulent job posting, or if you suspect you have received a fraudulent offer, you can report it to The New York Times at security@nytimes.com. You can also file a report with the Federal Trade Commission or your state attorney general.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst II
description:
Job Posting End Date: June 29

When you join the team at Unum, you become part of an organization committed to helping you thrive.

Here, we work to provide the employee benefits and service solutions that enable employees at our client companies to thrive throughout life’s moments. And this starts with ensuring that every one of our team members enjoys opportunities to succeed both professionally and personally. To enable this, we provide:

* Award-winning culture
* Inclusion and diversity as a priority
* Performance Based Incentive Plans
* Competitive benefits package that includes: Health, Vision, Dental, Short & Long-Term Disability
* Generous PTO (including paid time to volunteer!)
* Up to 9.5% 401(k) employer contribution
* Mental health support
* Career advancement opportunities
* Student loan repayment options
* Tuition reimbursement
* Flexible work environments

### ***\\*All the benefits listed above are subject to the terms of their individual Plans*** **.**

And that’s just the beginning…

With 10,000 employees helping more than 39 million people worldwide, every role at Unum is meaningful and impacts the lives of our customers. Whether you’re directly supporting a growing family, or developing online tools to help navigate a difficult loss, customers are counting on the combined talents of our entire team. Help us help others, and join Team Unum today!

**General Summary:**
--------------------

General Summary
  
  
This is a senior level individual contributor position that blends technical expertise with financial acumen to develop and perform moderately complex analyses under the supervision of a financial analysis director or manager. The incumbent will be expected to accomplish their work with little oversight and exhibit a proficiency with the tools and technical skillsets necessary for their area of responsibility. The individual will collaborate across finance and operations to drive optimal solutions for various financial and business issues. The ideal candidate will be a curious, creative, and analytical thinker who is passionate about leveraging data in tactical ways to help us solve our most challenging problems.

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities**

* Conduct moderately complex data profiling and analysis to evaluate data sources to determine the best source for business information
* Drive modernization and consistency across financial and operation models
* Develop new financial and operational models to drive operational efficiency
* Identify areas of risk and opportunities in operations and make recommendations reduce risk and leverage opportunities
* Acquiring, transforming and translating data into actionable dashboards, reports, algorithms or datasets
* Performing moderately complex statistical analysis and presenting findings to guide, influence and advise leadership
* Compile, synthesize, and communicate analytical findings in a clear and compelling manner to senior leadership, including actionable recommendations to support strategic decision-making.
* Collaborate with data engineers to perform data validation and testing activities as appropriate
* Continuously develop and build upon existing in-depth knowledge of the insurance industry, company and competitor landscape
* Continuously develop and build upon existing in-depth knowledge of data stored in company databases as well as emerging trends in business intelligence technologies
* Works directly with internal customers to refine requirements and validate output to ensure solutions will meet expectations
* May provide mentoring, coaching and developmental support to lower level BI Analysts

**Job Specifications**

* Bachelors Degree preferred, and/or equivalent experience
* 4+ years experience with demonstrated success at a BI Analyst I level or comparable data analytics related field
* Proficient in analytics programming languages (SQL/R/Python)
* Demonstrated expertise with modern BI toolsets (Tableau, Alteryx, PowerBI, or equivalent)
* Demonstrated understanding of data profiling, statistical analysis and data modeling concepts
* Proficient in extracting and leveraging data out of data warehouse, transactional databases, object stores & API based environments
* Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into technical solutions
* Ability to embrace change, adapt to the unexpected, and focus energies, people, and solutions on practical and positive results
* Demonstrated problem solving skills
* Strong communications skills with the ability to influence others using data and logic
* Ability to effectively mentor others
* Aptitude and drive to learn new technologies and analysis techniques
* Strong team player; able to work effectively within a team and more broadly with people from a variety of backgrounds and areas across the organization.

#LI-AF1

Unum and Colonial Life are part of Unum Group, a Fortune 500 company and leading provider of employee benefits to companies worldwide. Headquartered in Chattanooga, TN, with international offices in Ireland, Poland and the UK, Unum also has significant operations in Portland, ME, and Baton Rouge, LA - plus over 35 US field offices. Colonial Life is headquartered in Columbia, SC, with over 40 field offices nationwide.

Unum is an equal opportunity employer, considering all qualified applicants and employees for hiring, placement, and advancement, without regard to a person's race, color, religion, national origin, age, genetic information, military status, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or protected veteran status.

The base salary range for applicants for this position is listed below. Unless actual salary is indicated above in the job description, actual pay will be based on skill, geographical location and experience.

$80,630.00-$165,500.00

Additionally, Unum offers a portfolio of benefits and rewards that are competitive and comprehensive including healthcare benefits (health, vision, dental), insurance benefits (short & long-term disability), performance-based incentive plans, paid time off, and a 401(k) retirement plan with an employer match up to 5% and an additional 4.5% contribution whether you contribute to the plan or not. All benefits are subject to the terms and conditions of individual Plans.

Company:

Unum
